alert.note: Alert for Spokane Area; Washington Palouse (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 06 at 2:33AM PST until March 06 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Snow. Variable snow accumulations between 1 and 5 inches. Highest snow amounts between Tekoa and Spokane. * WHERE...Plummer, Pullman, Moscow, Colfax, Potlatch, Oakesdale, Downtown Spokane, Rosalia, Uniontown, La Crosse, Tekoa, Airway Heights, Rockford, Fairfield, Genesee, Spokane Valley, Cheney, and Davenport. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery, snow covered road conditions impacting the Monday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Persistent bands of moderate to heavy snow are impacting areas south of Spokane toward Tekoa and Tensed in the Palouse. This band is likely producing snowfall rates close to 1"/hour. These heavier snow showers will move toward the I-90 corridor in Spokane between 3-4AM. Additional snow showers will fill in throughout the advisory area throughout the morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
